post.date: Posted: Thu Jan 27, 2005 5:28 amÂ Â Â Post subject: Doom Chronicles "Test" Vid
post.author: Cody64
post.body:
We now have a new site (no longer hosted by D3files). The new site is: www.doomchronicles.com

Come on by and check out our new screens, and join our forums . We are always open to input from the community

Also, we have uploaded a "test" video today. It is not anything super fancy, nor does it show any of our story line. It strictly shows off some of our new stuff, and is mostly focused on our new g-gun (thanks to pbmax) and other weapon physics....

The vid is in high quality, and is qite long. So I am sorry to say that is about 100 megs I think you'll find the download worth it, cuz even some of our members found it amazing, and these guys use this stuff every day

We will be releasing another test vid soon, that shows off some of our other features (the next one will mostly be focused on gameplay, and the new AI squad). Also, note that we are lacking models ( and can really use some more modelers and animators) so we have no new models in this vid

The link to the vid is: http://www.doomchronicles.com/downloads/test_vid_001.rar

Hope you enjoy

BTW: I found one typo in the vid In the "thank you's" part of the credits, it says "me us".... I feel like a fool for not catching that b4 Oh well....

.genmed { font-size : 11px; }
.gensmall { font-size : 10px; }
.gen,.genmed,.gensmall { color : #000000; }

}

	font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 11px; color: #444444; line-height: 125%;
	background-color: #FAFAFA; border: #D1D7DC; border-style: solid;
	border-left-width: 1px; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px
}

a.copyright		{ color: #444444; text-decoration: none;}

	color : #000000;
	font: normal 11px Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	border-color : #000000;
}

/* The text input fields background colour */
input.post, textarea.post, select {
	background-color : #FFFFFF;
}

input { text-indent : 2px; }

/* The buttons used for bbCode styling in message post */

	background-color : #EFEFEF;
	color : #000000;
	font-size: 11px; font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
}

/* The main submit button option */
input.mainoption {
	background-color : #FAFAFA;
	font-weight : bold;
}

/* None-bold submit button */
input.liteoption {
	background-color : #FAFAFA;
	font-weight : normal;
}

/* This is the line in the posting page which shows the rollover
  help line. This is actually a text box, but if set to be the same
  colour as the background no one will know ;)

var curMonth = -1;
var yearCount = 18;
var firstYear = 1996;
var imgWidth = 475;
var yearImgWidth = 25;
var monthImgWidth = 2;
var trackerVal = "none";
var displayDay = "9";
var displayMonth = "May";
var displayYear = "2007";
var prettyMonths = ["Jan","Feb","Mar","Apr","May","Jun","Jul","Aug","Sep","Oct","Nov","Dec"];

function showTrackers(val) {
	if(val == trackerVal) {
		return;
	}
	if(val == "inline") {
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").style.color = "#ec008c";
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").style.color = "#ec008c";
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").style.color = "#ec008c";		
	} else {
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").innerHTML = displayYear;
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").style.color = "#ff0";
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").innerHTML = displayMonth;
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").style.color = "#ff0";
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").innerHTML = displayDay;
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").style.color = "#ff0";
	}
   document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackYearImg").style.display = val;
   document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackMonthImg").style.display = val;
   trackerVal = val;
}
function getElementX2(obj) {
	var thing = jQuery(obj);
	if((thing == undefined) 
			|| (typeof thing == "undefined") 
			|| (typeof thing.offset == "undefined")) {
		return getElementX(obj);
	}
	return Math.round(thing.offset().left);
}
function trackMouseMove(event,element) {

   var eventX = getEventX(event);
   var elementX = getElementX2(element);
   var xOff = eventX - elementX;
	if(xOff < 0) {
		xOff = 0;
	} else if(xOff > imgWidth) {
		xOff = imgWidth;
	}
   var monthOff = xOff % yearImgWidth;

   var year = Math.floor(xOff / yearImgWidth);
	var yearStart = year * yearImgWidth;
   var monthOfYear = Math.floor(monthOff / monthImgWidth);
   if(monthOfYear > 11) {
       monthOfYear = 11;
   }
   // 1 extra border pixel at the left edge of the year:
   var month = (year * 12) + monthOfYear;
   var day = 1;
	if(monthOff % 2 == 1) {
		day = 15;
	}
	var dateString = 
		zeroPad(year + firstYear) + 
		zeroPad(monthOfYear+1,2) +
		zeroPad(day,2) + "000000";

	var monthString = prettyMonths[monthOfYear];
	document.getElementById("displayYearEl").innerHTML = year + 1996;
	document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").innerHTML = monthString;
	// looks too jarring when it changes..
	//document.getElementById("displayDayEl").innerHTML = zeroPad(day,2);

	var url = wbPrefix + dateString + '/' +  wbCurrentUrl;
	document.getElementById('wm-graph-anchor').href = url;

   //document.getElementById("wmtbURL").value="evX("+eventX+") elX("+elementX+") xO("+xOff+") y("+year+") m("+month+") monthOff("+monthOff+") DS("+dateString+") Moy("+monthOfYear+") ms("+monthString+")";
   if(curYear != year) {
       var yrOff = year * yearImgWidth;
       document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackYearImg").style.left = yrOff + "px";
       curYear = year;
   }
   if(curMonth != month) {
       var mtOff = year + (month * monthImgWidth) + 1;
       document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackMonthImg").style.left = mtOff + "px";
       curMonth = month;
   }
}
//]]]] ><![CDATA[>

		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=74417&sid=16810b1c36df2a68da3af1b93afe0fad#74417"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Thu Jan 27, 2005 5:28 am<span class="gen"> </span>   Post subject: Doom Chronicles "Test" Vid</span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=74417&sid=16810b1c36df2a68da3af1b93afe0fad"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">We now have a new site (no longer hosted by D3files).  The new site is:  <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doomchronicles.com/" target="_blank" class="postlink">www.doomchronicles.com</a>
<br/><br/>
Come on by and check out our new screens, and join our forums  <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_biggrin.gif" alt="Very Happy" border="0"/> .  We are always open to input from the community <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_smile.gif" alt="Smile" border="0"/><br/><br/>
Also, we have uploaded a "test" video today.  It is not anything super fancy, nor does it show any of our story line.  It strictly shows off some of our new stuff, and is mostly focused on our new g-gun (thanks to pbmax) and other weapon physics....
<br/><br/>
The vid is in high quality, and is qite long.  So I am sorry to say that is about 100 megs <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_eek.gif" alt="Shocked" border="0"/>   I think you'll find the download worth it, cuz even some of our members found it amazing, and these guys use this stuff every day  <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_wink.gif" alt="Wink" border="0"/><br/><br/>
We will be releasing another test vid soon, that shows off some of our other features (the next one will mostly be focused on gameplay, and the new AI squad).  Also, note that we are lacking models ( and can really use some more modelers and animators) so we have no new models in this vid <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_sad.gif" alt="Sad" border="0"/><br/><br/>
The link to the vid is: <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doomchronicles.com/downloads/test_vid_001.rar" target="_blank" class="postlink">http://www.doomchronicles.com/downloads/test_vid_001.rar</a>
<br/><br/>
Hope you enjoy <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_biggrin.gif" alt="Very Happy" border="0"/><br/><br/>
BTW:  I found one typo in the vid <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_sad.gif" alt="Sad" border="0"/>  In the "thank you's" part of the credits, it says "me us"....  I feel like a fool for not catching that b4 <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_sad.gif" alt="Sad" border="0"/>  Oh well....</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=74417#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Excellent, I'm going to download the vid later on. Btw I read in a d3files interview that you guys are going to take a scary approach. Since you guys and myself are working on similarly-themed mods, what kind of scares can we expect to see?
<br/><br/>
-edit- btw lol I realised we're both creating invisible monsters - you guys are making a spectre, while I'm doing a poltergeist (invisible melee-only imp) lol
<br/><br/>
I find that my mod bears the largest similarity with Chronicles. Seems like we have much to learn from each other hehe</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
